The source of the claim: The expert's verdict mentions that the claim was sent to AFP via WhatsApp and can also be seen in Facebook posts that were shared more than 120 times. This aspect verifies the origin of the claim.
Personal testimony: The claim includes a personal testimony from a woman in the UK who believes she had COVID-19 and shares her experiences with the virus. This aspect verifies the personal perspective of the claim.
Lack of testing and specific symptoms: The expert's verdict points out that the claim does not mention whether the woman was tested for the novel coronavirus or provides specific details about her symptoms. This aspect highlights the lack of concrete evidence supporting the claim.
Expert opinion on treatment methods: The expert's verdict includes statements from experts who debunk certain treatment methods mentioned in the claim. This aspect verifies the validity of the treatment methods mentioned in the claim.
